Description:
Adam Waterous is the co-founder, Managing Partner, and CEO of the Waterous Energy Fund, a Calgary-based private equity firm investing in Canadian oil & gas. 

He is also Executive Chairman of Strathcona Resources, a public energy producer built via consolidation, and has strong ties to the Conservative Party through fundraising and donations.
Public affairs and communications consultant associated with Maple Leaf Strategies. She previously worked in government communications.
Andrew Potter is a journalist and academic. He has written for Canadian media and been associated with McGill Institute for the Study of Canada.
Barry Zekelman is the owner of Zekelman Industries, a large North American steel pipe and tube manufacturer.

Benjamin Alarie is a law professor at the University of Toronto, where he researches taxation, judicial decision-making, and AI in legal contexts. 

He is affiliated with the Vector Institute and the Schwartz Reisman Institute, and co-authored The Legal Singularity, exploring how AI could transform law.
Canadian fintech company providing credit reports, loans and personal finance tools.

Build Canada claims to be a non-partisan civic movement that aims to empower “builders” — entrepreneurs, creators, and innovators — to reshape Canada. Its members (seemingly volunteer based) share an anti-government, pro-industry vision of the future. Their political leanings range from centrist tech bros to right-wing tech bros.
Main right-wing federal political party in Canada. Current official opposition party.
Harley Finkelstein is President of Shopify; co-founded a tea company (Firebelly), and has a JD/MBA from University of Ottawa.
Pierre Poilievre is the leader of the Conservative Party of Canada, known for his right-wing populist, pro-industry message.

Strathcona Resources is a Calgary-based energy company formed in 2020 by the merger of Cona and Strath via Waterous Energy Fund. 

It focuses on long-life oil and gas assets and recently launched a formal takeover bid for MEG Energy.
Tobias Lutke is co-founder and CEO of Shopify. Originally from Germany, now Canadian, and married to Fiona McKean.
Waterous Energy Fund is a private equity firm founded in 2017 by Adam Waterous, focused on value-based investments in North American oil and gas.
Coalition for a Prosperous America is a pro-tariff, buy-American trade group representing American manufacturers. One member company, Zekelman Industries, has donated to a pro-Trump super PAC.
